head.title: Paper Company Moving To a Tower in Stamford

hedline.hl1: Paper Company Moving To a Tower in Stamford

abstract.p: International Paper plans to move corporate headquarters from Purchase, NY, to building in downtown Stamford, Conn, it acquired with purchase of Champion International (S)

block.p: International Paper, the world's largest producer of paper products, will move its corporate headquarters from Purchase to a 15-story building in downtown Stamford, which it obtained when it acquired Champion International, a rival paper producer, in late June. The company has 120 workers at its Purchase offices.
International Paper plans to sell the building in Stamford and lease back several floors.

The Empire State Development Corporation said it offered a package of incentives but was trumped by Connecticut's offer of a no-interest $1 million loan for building renovation, a sales tax exemption on construction work and a $5.2 million loan to rewire the building for communications.
